definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: To learn to take care of every single thing personally, encounter.
sentences.chinese: 杜绝事必躬亲，学会抓大放小。

sentences.english: My boss has a finger in every pie.
sentences.chinese: 我的老板是一个事必躬亲的人。

sentences.english: He had always been a "doer, " and his eagerness was often taken as arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 由于事必躬亲，他的急性子常被视为是一种傲慢。

sentences.english: Operators profess admiration for Chou's hands-on approach.
sentences.chinese: 运营商公开表示欣赏周的事必躬亲的态度。

definition: lit. things are not separated according to their size (idiom)/fig. to deal with any matter, regardless of its importance
see 事無巨細|事无巨细[shi4 wu2 ju4 xi4]
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
(idiom) take care of everything; handle everything
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
